   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Pupillary Light Response Simulation\n",
    "\n",
    "This notebook demonstrates how to simulate realistic pupillary light responses using the `simulate_pupil_measurement` function:\n",
    "- Creating basic simulated traces\n",
    "- Customizing simulation parameters\n",
    "- Understanding pupil response phases\n",
    "- Comparing different stimulus conditions\n",
    "- Adding noise and realistic variations"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 26,
   "id": "334c988b",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Import necessary libraries\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "\n",
    "import pypipr"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "eb3b5854",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## 1. Basic Pupil Response Simulation\n",
    "\n",
    "The `simulate_pupil_measurement` function creates a realistic pupillary light response with different phases:\n",
    "- **Baseline**: Stable pupil size before light onset\n",
    "- **Latency**: Brief delay after light onset\n",
    "- **Constriction**: Rapid pupil size reduction\n",
    "- **Sustained**: Maintained constriction during light exposure\n",
    "- **Redilation**: Exponential recovery after light offset"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 27,
   "id": "2b209132",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 800x200 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Create a basic simulated pupil measurement with default parameters\n",
    "pupil_measurement = pypipr.simulate_pupil_measurement()\n",
    "\n",
    "# Initialize the figure\n",
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 2))\n",
    "\n",
    "# Plot the pupil measurement and light stimulus\n",
    "pupil_measurement.plot(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"blue\",\n",
    "    linewidth=2,\n",
    "    label=\"Pupil Size\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "pupil_measurement.plot_light_stimulus(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"yellow\",\n",
    "    alpha=0.3,\n",
    "    label=\"Light Stimulus\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Show the plot\n",
    "ax.set_title(\"Simulated Pupil Response\")\n",
    "ax.legend()\n",
    "plt.show()\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "10a8fcca",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## 2. Customizing Simulation Parameters\n",
    "\n",
    "The simulation function allows you to control various aspects of the pupil response:\n",
    "\n",
    "### Timing Parameters:\n",
    "- `t_start`, `t_end`: Overall simulation time window\n",
    "- `t_light_onset`, `t_light_offset`: Light stimulus timing\n",
    "- `num_samples`: Number of data samples"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 28,
   "id": "293d6e15",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 800x200 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Create a simulation with custom timing parameters\n",
    "pupil_measurement = pypipr.simulate_pupil_measurement(\n",
    "    t_start=0.0,\n",
    "    t_end=16.0,\n",
    "    t_light_onset=2.0,\n",
    "    t_light_offset=6.0,\n",
    "    num_samples=1000\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Initialize the figure\n",
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 2))\n",
    "\n",
    "# Plot the pupil measurement and light stimulus\n",
    "pupil_measurement.plot(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"blue\",\n",
    "    linewidth=2,\n",
    "    label=\"Pupil Size\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "pupil_measurement.plot_light_stimulus(\n",
    "    ax=ax, \n",
    "    color=\"yellow\",\n",
    "    alpha=0.3,\n",
    "    label=\"Light Stimulus\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Show the plot\n",
    "ax.set_title(\"Simulated Pupil Response with Custom Timing\")\n",
    "ax.legend()\n",
    "plt.show()\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "b910d01a",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## 3. Customizing Response Parameters\n",
    "\n",
    "You can control the shape and magnitude of the pupil response by adjusting physiological parameters:\n",
    "\n",
    "### Response Shape Parameters:\n",
    "- `baseline_param_y0`: Initial pupil diameter (typical range: 4-8 mm)\n",
    "- `constrict_param_cv`: Constriction velocity - how fast the pupil contracts (negative values, typical: -20 to -30 mm/s)\n",
    "- `sustained_param_m`: Sustained phase slope - gradual change during light exposure\n",
    "- `sustained_param_c`: Sustained phase offset\n",
    "- `redilation_param_s`: Redilation amplitude scaling\n",
    "- `redilation_param_k`: Redilation rate constant (negative values for exponential recovery)\n",
    "- `redilation_param_p`: Redilation phase parameter\n",
    "\n",
    "Let's create a simulation with custom response parameters:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 29,
   "id": "07da5d15",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 800x200 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Create a simulation with custom response parameters\n",
    "pupil_measurement = pypipr.simulate_pupil_measurement(\n",
    "    baseline_param_y0=7.5,  # Larger baseline pupil size\n",
    "    constrict_param_cv=-24.0,  # Moderate constriction speed\n",
    "    sustained_param_m=0.1,  # Slight upward drift during sustained phase\n",
    "    redilation_param_k=-0.5,  # Redilation rate\n",
    "    redilation_param_p=6.2,  # Redilation shape parameter\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Initialize the figure\n",
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 2))\n",
    "\n",
    "# Plot the pupil measurement and light stimulus\n",
    "pupil_measurement.plot(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"blue\",\n",
    "    linewidth=2,\n",
    "    label=\"Pupil Size\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "pupil_measurement.plot_light_stimulus(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"yellow\",\n",
    "    alpha=0.3,\n",
    "    label=\"Light Stimulus\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Show the plot\n",
    "ax.set_title(\"Simulated Pupil Response with Custom Parameters\")\n",
    "ax.set_ylim(2, 8)\n",
    "ax.legend()\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "93a355ef",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## 4. Comparing Different Stimulus Conditions\n",
    "\n",
    "Let's simulate and compare different light stimulus conditions to understand how parameters affect the pupil response:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 30,
   "id": "cb8afd69",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Stimulus comparison:\n",
      "Short stimulus - Max constriction: 0.65 mm\n",
      "Long stimulus - Max constriction: 0.55 mm\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 800x200 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Create simulations with different stimulus durations and intensities (Red vs. Blue)\n",
    "red_stim = pypipr.simulate_pupil_measurement(\n",
    "    constrict_param_cv=-2.9,\n",
    "    t_peak_constrict_rel_to_light_onset=0.22,\n",
    "    redilation_param_k=-0.8,\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "blue_stim = pypipr.simulate_pupil_measurement(\n",
    "    constrict_param_cv=-3.0,\n",
    "    t_peak_constrict_rel_to_light_onset=0.25,\n",
    "    redilation_param_k=-0.4,\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Initialize the figure\n",
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(8, 2))\n",
    "\n",
    "# Show red stimulus\n",
    "red_stim.plot(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"red\",\n",
    "    linewidth=2,\n",
    "    label=\"Red stimulus\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "red_stim.plot_light_stimulus(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"yellow\",\n",
    "    alpha=0.3\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Show blue stimulus\n",
    "blue_stim.plot(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"blue\",\n",
    "    linewidth=2,\n",
    "    label=\"Blue stimulus\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Print comparison of maximum constriction\n",
    "print(\"Stimulus comparison:\")\n",
    "print(f\"Short stimulus - Max constriction: {np.nanmin(red_stim.get_size()):.2f} mm\")\n",
    "print(f\"Long stimulus - Max constriction: {np.nanmin(blue_stim.get_size()):.2f} mm\")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Show the plot\n",
    "ax.set_title(\"Light Stimulus comparison\")\n",
    "ax.legend()\n",
    "plt.show()\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "97745c5b",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## 5. Adding Realistic Noise and Variations\n",
    "\n",
    "Real pupillometry measurements contain noise from various sources. The simulation function allows you to add realistic noise components:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": null,
   "id": "96277d58",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 800x200 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Set random seed for reproducibility\n",
    "np.random.seed(0)\n",
    "\n",
    "# Create simulations with different noise levels\n",
    "clean_signal = pypipr.simulate_pupil_measurement(\n",
    "    noise_std=0.0,\n",
    "    trend_std=0.0\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "noisy_signal = pypipr.simulate_pupil_measurement(\n",
    "    noise_std=0.001, \n",
    "    trend_std=0.001\n",
    ")\n",
    "very_noisy_signal = pypipr.simulate_pupil_measurement(\n",
    "    noise_std=0.005,\n",
    "    trend_std=0.005\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Initialize the figure\n",
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(8, 2))\n",
    "\n",
    "# Plot noise comparison\n",
    "clean_signal.plot(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"green\",\n",
    "    linewidth=1.5,\n",
    "    label=\"No noise\"\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "noisy_signal.plot(\n",
    "    ax=ax,\n",
    "    color=\"orange\",\n",
    "    linewidth=1.5,\n",
    "    label=\"Moderate noise\"\n",
    "    )\n",
    "very_noisy_signal.plot(ax=ax, color=\"red\", linewidth=1.5, label=\"High noise\")\n",
    "\n",
    "clean_signal.plot_light_stimulus(ax=ax, color=\"yellow\", alpha=0.3)\n",
    "\n",
    "ax.legend()\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  }
 ],
